$interpreted: Naya: EH. We've been scurrying amongst the sands for days on end...forever wouldn't even feel this long! Are we there yet?
Nigel: Should be able to spot the bazaar soon.
Angelia: Really? Let's play I spy!
Angelia: I spy...a desert bazaar!
Naya: This is definitely not a pauper's bazaar! Whose ready for some gown shoppingggg!!!???
Angelia: Absolutely!
Nigel: ...Good girls gone mad. Have you already forgotten why we're here?
Angelia: ……….
Naya: ……….
Angelia: Of...of course not! It was only a joke.
Naya: Ugh, buzzkill!
Nigel: Hmph...
Angelia: Whoa~ packed like a can of sardines!
Naya: So many things I've never laid eyes upon within the Kingdom!
Nigel: The Commerce Chamber manages the Desert Bazaar. It's an independent organization without complicated regulations or taxation.
Nigel: One man's stash is another man's treasure.
Angelia: Does that include...the secret item you claim Theodore has come to own?
Naya: Hold it. Who's this contact you've mentioned? There's no shortage of unfamiliar faces here, and your assistants didn't provide any description.
Naya: Can you tell who it is?
Nigel: Ain't no one like him...a mechanican.
Angelia: What's a mechanican?!

Sherlock: Gather round, gather round~
Many exotic trinkets now in stock,
Sherlock: medicinal herbs from the East Alliance bound to cure any illness, and sacred charms unearthed from the Northern tundra.
Sherlock: Journey within and feast your eyes~
Nigel: Are you Sherlock?
Sherlock: That I am. What are my esteemed customers in search of?
Nigel: What you have laid out is not to my liking. I'm looking for a rare item.

Sherlock: Not a problem. After all, I am Vice President
of the Commerce Chamber. Name the item,
Sherlock: and I'll ensure delivery if the price is right!
Nigel: I'm looking for...the item you sold regent Theodore half a year ago...
Sherlock: Have you the coin to procure a trinket worth a king's ransom...?
Angelia: So Theodore...
Angelia: So you're saying that His Majesty King Theodore has indeed bought something of yours in the past? What was it?
Sherlock: I must respect the privacy of my customers. Who are you anyway? I have no reason to tell you.
Naya: Ugh, all this beating around the bush is agitating!
Sherlock: If you're not here for proper business, be gone! My hospitality is growing thin.
Naya: Oh, no you didn't!
Angelia: I'm sorry! We didn't mean to go so far. Are you alright?
Sherlock: Sixpence none the richer! There go my gears again...
Naya: Well, have you decided to answer us or not?
Sherlock: You won't crank a word out of me, not even if you reduce me to a pile of scrap metal.
Nigel: He's quite the character...wish he'd come with a user's manual.
Nigel: What if I told you, this young lady here is a noble from Kingdom of the Sun,
Nigel: and that you would benefit greatly from your willing cooperation?
Sherlock: Where's your proof?
Nigel: True blood nobles have a strand of hair that shines with even the slightest touch.
Nigel: Even a mechanical dummy like you surely knows this to be true?
Sherlock: Hmm...there's a small room in the back. Come, let me check.

Sherlock: ...Miss Noble, why didn't you say so earlier~
We wouldn't have gotten off on the wrong foot.
Angelia: We should have kept our hands to ourselves. Please forgive us.
Naya: Ugh. Well lookie what we have here, a sycophant...
Nigel: Can you tell us exactly what Theodore bought?
Sherlock: Err...although the lady has promised me fortunes, it's often muttered in the market that snitches get...
Sherlock: ...their gears ripped out from the area where a human's buttocks are located. If word of this gets out it'll ruin my reputation...
Naya: ARGH! WHAT DO YOU WANT THEN?!
Sherlock: Perhaps, a favor will do. Let's make a deal.
Nigel: What favor would that be?
Sherlock: There's a desert disturber of the name Ned not far from our bazaar. Scallywag stole my most prized possession, the Rainbow Roses.
Sherlock: If you retrieve them for me, I'd sell Theodore's soul to the devil...
Nigel: That's all?
Naya: And how do I know that you'll keep your word?

Sherlock: Cross my engine and hope to standby, merchants
like us live on integrity. Want a pinky promise?
Nigel: Drastic times call for drastic measures.
Naya: A brutal bandit on the loose? Might as well bring him in for justice.
Angelia: We'll be off to complete your request, Sir Sherlock.
Sherlock: Take your time. And remember to not show any mercy~
Sherlock: Chugga Chugga...CHA-CHING!

ARGH! WHAT DO YOU WANT THEN?!

What favor would that be?

Cross my engine and hope to standby, merchants
like us live on integrity. Want a pinky promise?

We'll be off to complete your request, Sir Sherlock.
Take your time. And remember to not show any mercy~
Chugga Chugga...CHA-CHING!
